head.title: NetBSD/hp700: Changing to Serial Console on HP 9000/712 models

para.emphasis: WARNING: Improper setting of the console path may cause the system to become inoperable. Beware.

sect1.para: Unfortunately, HP decided that the 712 should be hard to configure for headless use. Briefly, you must get to the HP-UX bootloader prompt (which they call the ISL) which will allow you to permanently set your preferred console location to the first serial port at 9600 8N1.
The original source of this information is http://lists.parisc-linux.org/pipermail/parisc-linux/1999-December/008117.html.
To change to a serial console, you need:

orderedlist.listitem: a monitor with VGA style interface
the HP-UX ISL (either an HP-UX bootable hard drive or netboot)

sect1.para: First, you need to get to the BootROM prompt. When your system prints the following on screen, press and hold ESC until you get the BOOT_ADMIN> prompt: Press <ESCAPE> to stop boot sequence.

sect2.title: Step 1: Setting monitor type
sect2.para: If your display doesn't show properly, the frequency may be out-of-range. You can select the monitor type suitable to your display.
If your 712 has the add-in VRAM board, normal VGA 680x480 mode is monitor type 7. Without the VRAM board, the number may be different (possibly 5?).
sect2.programlisting:
BOOT_ADMIN> monitor 7 Monitor Choices Type Resolution Frequency ---- ---------- --------- 1 1280x1024 72Hz 2 1024x768 75Hz 3 1024x768 70Hz 4 1024x768 75Hz Flat Panel 5 1280x1024 60Hz 6 1024x768 60Hz 7 640x480 60Hz 8 1280x1024 75Hz VESA 9 1024x768 75Hz VESA 10 800x600 75Hz VESA 11 640x480 75Hz VESA 12 1280x1024 72Hz Greyscale 13 1280x1024 50Hz
Current Monitor Type is 7 640x480 60Hz
BOOT_ADMIN> reset

sect2.title: Step 2, Case 1: If you have HP-UX installed on local disk
sect2.programlisting:
BOOT_ADMIN> boot pri isl
Booting
ISL Revision A.00.38 OCT 26, 1994
ISL>

sect2.title: Step 2, Case 2: If you don't have HP-UX

orderedlist.listitem: Get the firmware update (PF_C7120023) from HP site (but we are not updating firmware here).

Extract the binary.
% mkdir /tmp/712 % cd /tmp/712 % sh /somewhere/PF_C7120023 x - C7120023.text Compiling unpacker for non-ascii files /tmp/ccIy0Rg8.o: warning: this program uses gets(), which is unsafe. x - C7120023.frm [compressed] ERROR: wc results of C7120023.frm are 5518 32547 709632 should be 5518 22318 709632 % rm /tmp/uud*end
The checksum may not match if you execute this on an OS other than HP-UX, which is probably OK.
Set up netbooting (using BOOTP and tftp) to boot the file extracted above (just specify C7120023.frm in dhcpd.conf or bootptab, and setup tftpd).

Boot 712 from LAN.
BOOT_ADMIN> boot lan isl
Booting
ISL Revision A.00.25 November 18, 1992
ISL>

sect2.title: Step 3: Setting console location
sect2.para: Run the following command to set your 712 to use a serial console:
To set your 712 to use the local console (i.e. keyboard and screen), run the following command:

You can use the display and information commands to verify that your settings have been stored properly. Once you're sure everything looks right, power cycle your workstation to start using your serial console.

Additionally, you can temporarily use the local console by pressing the Esc key on the PS/2 keyboard while resetting. This is setting only affects the console location temporarily and only works with firmware rev 1.6 and later.
